syllabus:
E

**_English_** **_(III)_**: **_Sports English_** (Syllabus for 2022 Spring Semester)          _Shih-wen LEE_

Email: **[t22032@ntnu.edu.tw](mailto:t22032@cc.ntnu.edu.tw)**      Office: #805, Cheng Building 8th F      Office Hours: 4-6 p.m., Friday

**Course Objectives:** This course aims to help students become better English learners through studying selected articles or essays about the history, development, events, and competitions of diverse sports. Most of the handouts are adapted from sports textbooks, the Internet, and encyclopedia or Wikipedia. The sports to be introduced are those that enjoy greater popularity in everyday life and on TV broadcast in Taiwan.

**Requirements** and **Rules:**

(1) **Regular attendance is required**. Any reasonable absences should inform the teacher in advance or submit a formal leave-record afterwards. Students who are absent from the class without **online leave-record**s or **who forget to bring the handout**s for each class meeting will get a **2-point deduction** of their **final** grades each time.

(2) No smartphone, i-pad, e-reader, or notebook computer using is allowed during the class and exam time. Violators will get a **2-point deduction** of their final grades for each violation. **DO NOT** look around or cheat in in-class exercises and exams. Students who violate the honesty policy will result in failing this course.

**Grading** **Policies: Attendance**: **10%**; Online assignments and In-class exercises: **40%**; **Mid-term**: **25%** and **Final exam**: **25%**
